function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Close proximity of urban homes and population density may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to public services such as sanitation and clean water may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pattern of increased calls to domestic violence helpline since march 2020","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited availability of data by state for analysis","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise in calls to the helpline from all age groups, with larger effects in july","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in calls to helpline for violence against women in peru after stay-at-home policies started","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rise in domestic violence in peru where almost 60 percent of women experienced violence before the virus arrived","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focused sample of households in rural western uganda may not be representative of the population of uganda and may lead to biased results.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on google’s community mobility report for severity of lockdown may not account for demographic or socioeconomic differences within the countries.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid urbanisation and globalisation leading to increased physical and mental health issues","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to services and facilities due to lockdown measures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proximity to green space in residential areas","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underprovision of public parks without market interventions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incentivizing higher land values over green and open spaces in city centres.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to green space in deprived areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large numbers of people entering parks against guidelines","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower quality green space in poorer communities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of benefits from poorly maintained large parks","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Assumption of benefits from proximity to parks","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Budget cuts to parks lead to a decline in the quality and quantity of green space.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper planning, designing, and managing of green space reduces its positive impact on community health.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to nature and outdoor spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Grand lockdown","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate information integration and analytics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate exploitation of disaster management infrastructures and smart city frameworks to counter the pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accumulation of an unprecedented amount of data without effective utilization for pandemic management","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of accurate pandemic data collection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliability and scalability issues in pandemic data modeling","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of inadequate surveillance and monitoring of infectious diseases in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks associated with insufficient data representation and semantic analysis of covid-19 information","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited capabilities in addressing technical challenges of covid-19 analytics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on big data analytics for real-time contact tracing can result in privacy breaches and data security risks.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilization of ontological reasoning and knowledge graphs may lead to inaccuracies in covid-19 analytics and recommendations.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of systematic studies exploring the utilization of ontologies in designing and supporting covid-19 analytics can lead to limited understanding and suboptimal use of ontological solutions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Missing out on latest studies and preprints","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate analysis of covid-19 specific ontologies","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in study selection","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of duplicate studies inclusion","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proposing new ontologies without proper validation or testing","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on the tools used to develop proposed ontologies","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited automation of existing tools for rule execution and data annotation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential dissemination of inaccurate or misleading information about covid-19 due to the use of semi-autonomous systems and telehealth care.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization in data collection and annotation for covid-19 medication","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate semantic interoperability of unstructured data in the covid-19 domain","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of data from iot sensors for covid-19 infection transmission and health symptoms monitoring","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of rigor in evaluating proposed solutions","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Immaturity of covid-19 analytics literature","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shedding of sars-cov-2 virus in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating the number of infected individuals from wastewater viral rna copy numbers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in wastewater and potential exposure to the virus during wastewater handling","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
